content.description:
<math alttext="The figure presents a 7 column table with 1 row of data. The heading for column 1 is “x.” The heading for column 2 is “f of x.” The heading for column 3 is “f prime of x.” The heading for column 4 is “f double prime of x.” The heading for column 5 is “g of x.” The heading for column 6 is “g prime of x.” The heading for column 7 is “g double prime of x.” There is 1 row of data. The data in the table are as follows. Row 1. Column 1, x is 2. Column 2. f of x is 4. Column 3. f prime of x is negative 3. Column 4. f double prime of x is 3. Column 5. g of x is negative 2. Column 6. g prime of x is 5. Column 7. g double prime of x is 1." overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtable columnlines="solid" equalcolumns="true" equalrows="true" frame="solid" rowlines="solid" width="auto"> <mtr> <mtd> <mi>x</mi> </mtd> <mtd> <mi>f</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <msup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>′</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mtext>  </mtext> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <msup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>″</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> <mtext>  </mtext> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <msup> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>′</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mtd> <mtd> <msup> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>″</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mtd> </mtr> <mtr> <mtd> <mn>2</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>4</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mo>−</mo> <mn>3</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>3</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mo>−</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>5</mn> </mtd> <mtd> <mn>1</mn> </mtd> </mtr> </mtable> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>

The table above gives values of the twice-differentiable functions <math alttext="f" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and <math alttext="g" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and their derivatives at <math alttext="x equals 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: If <math alttext="h" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> is the function defined by <math alttext="h of x, equals, the fraction with numerator f prime of x, and denominator g of x" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mi>h</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mi>f</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>′</mo> </mrow> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>g</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>x</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>, what is the value of <math alttext="h prime of 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>h</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>′</mo></mrow></msup><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
